title: Introduction to the Gospel of Mary

questions.question: When was the Berlin Codex, containing the Gospel of Mary, discovered?
Who published the first English translation of the Gospel of Mary?
choices: George MacRae and R. McL. Wilson
questions.answer: George MacRae and R. McL. Wilson

questions.question: How many manuscript fragments of the Gospel of Mary have been discovered?
questions.answer: Three

questions.question: What is the approximate composition date of the Gospel of Mary?
questions.answer: Early 2nd century CE

questions.question: In the Gospel of Mary, what does the phrase 'Son of Man' refer to?
choices: The true spiritual nature of humanity
questions.answer: The true spiritual nature of humanity

questions.question: According to the Gospel of Mary, where does the 'child of true Humanity' exist?
questions.answer: Within each person

questions.question: What role does Mary Magdalene play in comforting the disciples after the Savior's departure?
choices: She urges them not to grieve and praises the Savior's greatness
She rebukes them for their lack of faith
She tells them to wait for the Holy Spirit
questions.answer: She urges them not to grieve and praises the Savior's greatness

questions.question: According to the Gospel of Mary, what faculty is responsible for perceiving visions?
questions.answer: The mind

questions.question: Which philosophical traditions share similarities with the Gospel of Mary's emphasis on the mind?
questions.answer: Platonism and Stoicism

questions.question: What is the significance of Mary's vision in the Gospel of Mary?
choices: It proves her superiority over the other disciples
It reveals the date of Jesus' return
It gives her special knowledge and authority to teach
It shows her physical ascension to heaven
questions.answer: It gives her special knowledge and authority to teach

questions.question: Which disciple asks Mary to share the words of the Savior that the others haven't heard?
questions.answer: Peter

questions.question: What is the main focus of the Gospel of Mary's teachings compared to the canonical gospels?
choices: Parables about the Kingdom of God
questions.answer: Post-resurrection spiritual teachings

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Mary's view on the nature of matter differ from orthodox Christian teachings?
choices: It views matter as inherently evil
It sees matter as an illusion
It considers matter to be eternal
It regards matter as created by God and good
questions.answer: It views matter as inherently evil

questions.question: What is the significance of the Gospel of Mary being written in Coptic?
choices: It proves the text originated in Egypt
It indicates a later date of composition
It suggests the text was intended for a non-Greek speaking audience
It demonstrates the text's canonical status
questions.answer: It suggests the text was intended for a non-Greek speaking audience

questions.question: Which collection of texts, discovered in 1945, provided additional context for understanding the Gospel of Mary?
questions.answer: The Nag Hammadi Library

questions.question: What is the primary genre of the Gospel of Mary?
questions.answer: Dialogue

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Mary portray the relationship between Jesus and Mary Magdalene?
questions.answer: As teacher and student

questions.question: What concept does the Gospel of Mary emphasize as the path to salvation?
choices: Faith in Jesus' death and resurrection
Self-knowledge and understanding of one's true nature
Ascetic practices and withdrawal from the world
questions.answer: Self-knowledge and understanding of one's true nature

questions.question: Which male disciples are portrayed as opposing Mary's teachings in the Gospel of Mary?
questions.answer: Peter and Andrew

questions.question: What does the Gospel of Mary suggest about the nature of sin?
choices: Sin is a violation of God's law
Sin is produced by acting according to one's adulterated nature
Sin is necessary for spiritual growth
questions.answer: Sin is produced by acting according to one's adulterated nature

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Mary's portrayal of the disciples differ from the canonical gospels?
choices: The disciples are more confident and understanding
The disciples are more fearful and confused
The disciples are absent from the narrative
The disciples are portrayed as equal to Jesus
questions.answer: The disciples are more fearful and confused

questions.question: What is the significance of the missing pages in the Berlin Codex version of the Gospel of Mary?
choices: They contain secret teachings intentionally removed
They were destroyed by orthodox Christians
They leave gaps in our understanding of the text's full content
They prove the text is incomplete and unreliable
questions.answer: They leave gaps in our understanding of the text's full content

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Mary's Christology differ from that of the canonical gospels?
choices: It emphasizes Jesus' divinity more strongly
It portrays Jesus primarily as a wisdom teacher
It focuses on Jesus' role as a political messiah
questions.answer: It portrays Jesus primarily as a wisdom teacher

questions.question: What is the significance of the Gospel of Mary for understanding early Christian views on gender?
choices: It proves that women were universally accepted as leaders in early Christianity
It suggests that some early Christian communities accepted women in leadership roles
It shows that women were completely excluded from leadership in early Christianity
It demonstrates that gender was not a significant issue in early Christianity
questions.answer: It suggests that some early Christian communities accepted women in leadership roles

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Mary's view of the body compare to orthodox Christian teachings?
choices: It sees the body as a temple of the Holy Spirit
It views the body as neutral
It considers the body as something to be transcended
It celebrates the body as inherently good
questions.answer: It considers the body as something to be transcended

questions.question: What is the primary language of the Berlin Codex version of the Gospel of Mary?
questions.answer: Coptic

questions.question: Which early church father first mentioned the Gospel of Mary in his writings?
questions.answer: None of the above

questions.question: What is the significance of the Gospel of Mary being excluded from the New Testament canon?
choices: It proves the text is heretical
It demonstrates the text's late composition date
It reflects the diversity of early Christian beliefs and practices
It shows the text was unknown to early Christians
questions.answer: It reflects the diversity of early Christian beliefs and practices

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Mary's understanding of salvation differ from orthodox Christianity?
choices: It focuses on inner knowledge rather than belief in Jesus' death and resurrection
It denies the possibility of salvation
questions.answer: It focuses on inner knowledge rather than belief in Jesus' death and resurrection

questions.question: What is the significance of the dialogue format in the Gospel of Mary?
choices: It proves the text's historical accuracy
It emphasizes the importance of questioning and seeking understanding
It shows the text was meant to be performed dramatically
It indicates the text was written by multiple authors
questions.answer: It emphasizes the importance of questioning and seeking understanding
